newsitem.title: USA: American Craft begins to ship Mexican beer.
newsitem.headline: American Craft begins to ship Mexican beer.

text.p: American Craft Brewing International Ltd on Tuesday said its largest micro-brewery had begun making beer and planned to start shipping it in early June.

The brewery in Tecate, Mexico, will distribute its Mexicali brand of lager beer in the northern Mexican state of Baja California, the United States and other countries, the company said. Its distribution subsidiary AmBrew USA would handle shipments in the United States.
A company official said the brewery had started producing virtually at capacity -- 15,000 barrels a year, or three times more than the two other breweries that it owns.
A micro-brewery has an annual production of no more than 15,000 barrels, or 200,000 cases of 24 355-ml bottles.
AmBrew owns the South China Brewery Co in Hong Kong and operates a joint venture with Aidan McGuinness that runs a brewery near Dublin, Ireland, called Celtic Brew.
On May 1, it signed a supply agreement with Anheuser-Busch Cos Inc to work together on future brewing and marketing projects.
